oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The History of Europe and its Constituent Countries. Considerations in Favour of the New Europe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vergara, Javier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This article analyses the process of the development of Europe. The discussion is divided into three parts. First, the idea of a European identity with its humanizing, civilizing and Christian dimensions; we will consider how this served as the original foundation for a European identity. The second part looks into the diverse attempts to create a united Europe based on efforts to overcome models which in their turn sprang from nationalist perspectives. Finally, it examines the idea of a European interculturism whose foundation is a commitment to ethics and education.
